intro: Columnea cerropirrana, commonly known as the red-tipped columnea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or trailing vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Columnea cerropirrana is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation in suitable conditions.
